conclusion: The automobile slows linearly from 30 m/s to 10 m/s in 5 s.
The average speed of the car during the interval is 20 m/s.
In the same 5 s, the truck keeps a constant speed of 10 m/s.
In those 5 s, the car covers 100 m.
In those 5 s, the truck covers 50 m.
The original gap is only 30 m.
The car closes the gap (50 m > 30 m) before the 5 s are up.
The car will indeed collide with the truck.
